text: Edmond Bacri known by the professional name Eddy Marnay (Algiers, 18 December 1920 - 3 January 2003), was a French songwriter. In his career, he wrote more than 4000 songs, including works for Édith Piaf, Frida Boccara and Céline Dion. He was joint winner, as lyricist, of the Eurovision Song Contest in 1969 for Un Jour, Un Enfant, sung by Frida Boccara. He also wrote the title song for Charlie Chaplin's 1957 film A King in New York. Céline Dion named one of her sons after him in 2010, as Marnay produced and helped write Dion's first five records. ==References== ==Further reading== * * Category:1920 births Category:2003 deaths Category:Burials at Montmartre Cemetery Category:Algerian emigrants to France Category:French people of Algerian descent Category:French composers Category:French male composers Category:People from Algiers Category:Eurovision Song Contest winners Category:20th-century French musicians Category:20th-century French male musicians
title: Eddy Marnay
